intro: Camptopus densinervius, commonly known as the dense-veined camptopus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
